Articles.Content:
Another in my imaginatively titled X series of planes, the I.T.X 62. Capable of putting a kerbal on the moon, possibly further. Since the trip, ladders have been added to allow the kerbal to actually get out when he gets there.

1 fires the downward facing rockets,

2 the jets

3 the nuke

A truly daft number of air intakes, so fly high and fast and you can get a decent apoapsis on jets only.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

https://www.dropbox.com/s/bitd2yg4sv01z2s/X62.craft

Apparently it can make a round trip to eve. Even with my inept piloting.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Wow, looks simple, and small. I like it

The I.T. X62 Duna variant.

With the aid of very high kerbal orbit refuelling, makes it to Duna surface and back to land on Kerbal.

To be honest, as I emptied the jet fuel tank in orbit and am a very poor pilot, it might be that a skilled pilot could do surface to surface and back again. ( skilled pilot might remember to put the ladder up before launch)

9 fires the parachutes

https://www.dropbox.com/s/2g3y38s4ik5iahg/X62%20Duna.craft

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The I.T. X64 a

Seven Kerbals to a range of orbits, bundles of fuel left when you get there. Extremely precarious ladder arrangement.

There is a VTOL version shown, but that has a tendency to malfunction just a little bit upon landing.

Published version includes downward facing rocket motors for landing on non-atmospheric bodies, if you fancy that sort of thing.

1-downward rockets

2-jets

3-nukes

https://www.dropbox.com/s/nb6oucf59xj7rid/X64%20a.craft

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Wow! A small, interplanetary SSTO! Nice job! I will be sure to mess around with this one!

The I.T. X76

My attempt at minimalism. I don't think I'm very good at minimalism (76 parts..)

2 for the jets, 3 for the engines.

(Oh, glides like a pig. Powered landings only )

https://www.dropbox.com/s/f5he1sci2a4qx67/x76.craft

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited November 22, 2013 by Fellow314

The I.T. X88e

Vastly overpowered in atmosphere, non-optimal engine placement and a bugger to land.

2 -jets

3-rockets.

The I.T. X89e

A work in progress. The Duna landing was scuppered by some idiot not putting an RTG on the lander unit.
